titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edward Cyrus Cole Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Manuscripts and Archives Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:34

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, subject files, articles, speeches, book reviews, and material on the Yale School of Drama, including Cole's course notes, production notes, reports, financial papers and slides of productions. The subject files are of particular interest for the material from the early days of television, ca. 1948. Cole's work as a theater consultant is shown in the blue prints and other material prepared for theaters in Dresden, Malmo, Philadelphia and Stanford.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This bulk of the materials are open for research. A file of student grades in the 1980 accession is restricted until April 8, 2055, and Accession 1986-M-032 is closed until processed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edward Cyrus Cole Papers (MS 908). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Edward C. Cole, 1970 and 1980, and transferred from the Yale Drama School, 1985; the Yale Drama Library, 1989; and the Yale Art and Architecture Library, 2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Edward C. Cole (1904-): faculty member of the Yale University School of Drama, 1930-1966; production consultant for TV station WRGB, Schnectady, 1944; theater planning consultant from 1937.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, subject files, articles, speeches, book reviews, and material on the Yale School of Drama, including Cole's course notes, production notes, reports, financial papers and slides of productions. The subject files are of particular interest for the material from the early days of television, ca. 1948. Cole's work as a theater consultant is shown in the blue prints and other material prepared for theaters in Dresden, Malmo, Philadelphia and Stanford.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

White House Conference on Children and Youth
National Council of the Arts in Education (NCAE)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of files of the American Educational Theatre Association's architecture project in which Edward Cole participated. The files are arranged by state names within numerically designated geographic regions. The original order of files has been maintained. Regions 11-16 vary between the listing in folder 1 and the actual files.

did.unittitle: Listing of regions and architectural specifications
